result.execSummary:
The defendant Todd M Penrod was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Court orders defendant to pay all costs, fees, and surcharges, including DNA surcharge by 3/29/2015 or a civil judgment to be entered with tax intercept. Bail on deposit to be applied if applicable.

TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.
Consecutive to: To any other sentence, with credit for 4 days time served.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Todd M Penrod

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Todd M Penrod in court with attorney Allison Marie Ritter.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.

The defendant has complied with the Deferred Prosecution Agreement.
On motion of the state, the court amended the charge to Possession of THC, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 961.41(3g)(e), a class U misdemeanor.   Court ordered entry of judgment of conviction to the amended charge.

Court sentenced defendant to serve 4 DAYS in the House of Correction CONSECUTIVE to any sentence with credit for 4 days served; TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.

Court orders defendant to pay all cost, fees and surcharges, including DNA surcharge by 3/9/2015 or a civil judgment to be entered with tax intercept.  Bail on deposit to be applied if applicable.

Filed,
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.

Defendant Todd M Penrod in court with attorney Allison Marie Ritter.  Brad A. Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant needs three good urine screens; otherwise, doing well.  Based upon the defendant's compliance with Deferred Prosecution Agreement, matter is adjourned for final review hearing in Branch 6.  Review hearing scheduled for 01-06-2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Todd M Penrod in court with attorney Allison Marie Ritter.  Brad A. Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.  Court reviewed the report.  Defendant is consistently attending treatment and testing negative.  Defendant to begin community service.  Review hearing scheduled for December 1, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Todd M Penrod in court with attorney Allison M Ritter.  Nathaniel E Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Early Intervention Program Deferred Prosecution Agreement received and filed.  Court approves the agreement.

Defendant waives constitutional rights, enters a plea of GUILTY and is examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum  received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the Complaint as a factual basis for judgment.  Court finds defendant guilty as charged in the Information and STAYS a judgment of conviction.  Review hearing scheduled for July 28, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Todd M Penrod in court with attorney Allison M Ritter.  Nathaniel Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Defendant does qualify for DPA and has been evaluated by JusticePoint.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 44.  Plea hearing scheduled for June 4, 2014 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Todd M Penrod in court with attorney Allison M Ritter.  Nathaniel E Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Defense advises the Court the DPA was denied.  Defense needs to get more information to the State.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 22, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Todd M Penrod in court with attorney Allison M Ritter.  William Levins for Nathaniel Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Case may be resolved with a possible deferred prosecution agreement.  Plea hearing scheduled for May 13, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Todd M Penrod in court with attorney Allison Marie Ritter.  Step Nolten for Nathaniel Emery Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Konkol, Branch 44. Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 23, 2014 at 08:30 am.

No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription taken in the manner and fashion as prescribed.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Todd M Penrod in court with attorney Melissa J. Fitzsimmons.  Defendant Todd M Penrod in custody.  Carole R. Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Konkol, Branch 44. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION IF RELEASED FROM CUSTODY.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 4, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
